summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview conducted on August 5, 2021, with a staff member of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019. The document lists numerous attachments, including the interview transcript, assignment rosters, logs, and other records from the days surrounding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; a federal inmate housed at MCC New York who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019.

events.title: OIG Interview of MCC Staff Member
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary interview of an MCC New York staff member assigned to the Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is investigating the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Register Number 76318-054).
The investigation includes an interview with an MCC New York staff member who was assigned to the Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein was found unresponsive.
The memorandum references numerous attached documents, including daily assignment rosters, activity logs, count documentation, and cell search records from August 9-10, 2019.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG, indicating it is a factual record of the interview and collected evidence.
